snippet: Lawmakers expressed support for a bill that they say would address safety concerns that arose when the U.S. Supreme Court struck down buffer zones for demonstrators at abortion clinics.
abstract: Massachusetts lawmakers express support for bill that would prohibit individuals from deliberately impeding patients or staff members entering or leaving reproductive health care facilities, and allow law enforcement authorities to give dispersal orders when at least two individuals did so; bill would also proscribe interfering with vehicles entering or leaving and prohibit individuals from injuring or intimidating anyone trying to use abortion clinic.
lead_paragraph: Lawmakers expressed support for a bill that they say would address safety concerns that arose when the U.S. Supreme Court struck down buffer zones for demonstrators at abortion clinics.

headline.main: Abortion Clinic Protections Proposed in Massachusetts
headline.print_headline: Abortion Clinic Protections Proposed in Massachusetts
